_description: A proverbial phrase in the Fasciculus morum — one couplet

BodLauMis111.Note:
Written as prose; followed by prose saying, ‘Aske and
                    haue’.

Bod187.Transcription:
Goode bydders god wernyþTo goode bydders god goodelich
                    ȝeuyþ

Bod410.Transcription: Goode bydder goode wernerTo gode bydder fre ȝeuer

Bod687.Transcription:
god byddyþ god worneþto god byddyþ fre
                    þeuer

BodRawC670.Transcription: Goode bydder goode wernerTo gode bydder fre ȝeuer
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 204.

CamGon364.Transcription: A good asker a good warnerTo good byddyth for ȝeuyth

CantLitD14.Transcription: to a goode bidder goode wernarTo goode bidder fre yever
CantLitD14.Note: Written as prose with Latin prose betwen.

Eton34.Note: Written as prose; f. 165 of continuous foliation.

Lincoln44.Transcription:
Gode by dere goude worun… [one Latin line]To gode byddyr
                    fre ȝeuer

Spalding.Transcription: Good bydder goode wernerTo a good bydder a good gyfer
Spalding.Note: Two lines separated by Latin prose; written as prose.

WorcF19.Transcription: to gode byder god wernereto god byder fro gyfer
WorcF19.Note:
Wenzel lists as ‘B’ under ‘Other English
                    Phrases’, Fasc. Morum, p. 204. 1 x 2, separated by Latin prose; written as
                    prose.
